definition: to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: Safekeeping of all departments to be accurate staff scheduling table.
sentences.chinese: 各部门需妥善保管准确的员工排班表。

sentences.english: Prepare efficient schedules for management and associates.
sentences.chinese: 编定有效的部门排班表。

sentences.english: You must work when rostered on.
sentences.chinese: 您必须根据部门排班表工作。

sentences.english: It is your responsibility to be in attendance for each shift rostered.
sentences.chinese: 依照排班表按时上班是您的责任。

sentences.english: See that line of cabs there?
sentences.chinese: 那里有排班的计程车。有看到吗？

sentences.english: Methods Fixed night-shift was adopted and the responsible-nurse was in charge in the ward.
sentences.chinese: 方法采取固定夜班制，主管护士负责制的排班方法。

definition: to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
to hand over to the next workshift
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
